episodeTitle: To the Navy Headquarters! Off to Rescue Ace!
description: The escaped prisoners celebrate their freedom aboard a hijacked Marine vessel. Shiryu saves Blackbeard's crew with antidotes and joins them. When a Marine officer reveals Buggy was a member of the Roger Pirates and connected to Shanks, the prisoners rally behind him as he convinces them to head to Marine Headquarters.

openingSong.title: Kaze wo Sagashite
openingSong.artist: Mari Yaguchi and the Straw Hats

events.title: Shiryu Saves Blackbeard Pirates with Antidotes
events.description: On Level 4 of Impel Down, Shiryu provides antidotes to Magellan's deadly poison, saving Blackbeard and his entire crew from certain death. This act of mercy comes with a condition - Shiryu wishes to join their crew.
events.significance: This marks the turning point for the Blackbeard Pirates' raid on Impel Down and sets up Shiryu as one of Blackbeard's most powerful crew members. It also demonstrates Shiryu's willingness to abandon his position as Head Jailer.

events.title: Shiryu Joins the Blackbeard Pirates
events.description: After saving Blackbeard's crew from Magellan's poison, Shiryu officially joins the Blackbeard Pirates. Blackbeard welcomes him into the crew, recognizing Shiryu's immense power and value as a former Head Jailer of Impel Down.
events.significance: Shiryu becomes one of the Ten Titanic Captains and is considered the second strongest member of Blackbeard's crew. This recruitment significantly strengthens Blackbeard's forces and foreshadows his rise to Yonko status.

quotes.speaker: Shiryu
quotes.context: Shiryu's decision to join the Blackbeard Pirates after providing the antidotes

events.title: Escaped Prisoners Celebrate Freedom
events.description: The escaped prisoners from Impel Down celebrate their newfound freedom aboard a hijacked Marine vessel. They are traveling via the government-exclusive Tarai Current, a special waterway that connects major World Government facilities.
events.significance: This moment marks the successful escape from the supposedly inescapable Impel Down prison, one of the most significant security breaches in World Government history.

events.title: Buggy's Past as Roger Pirate Revealed
events.description: A Marine officer contacts the escaped prisoners' ship via Den Den Mushi and reveals that Buggy the Clown was formerly a member of Gol D. Roger's legendary pirate crew. This shocking revelation elevates Buggy's status in the eyes of all the escaped prisoners.
events.significance: This is the first time many characters and viewers learn of Buggy's connection to the Pirate King. This revelation becomes a crucial factor in Buggy's eventual rise to Warlord and later Yonko status, as it dramatically increases his reputation despite his relatively weak actual power.

quotes.text: Buggy the Clown was formerly on Gol D. Roger's pirate ship!
quotes.speaker: Marine Officer
quotes.context: The Marine officer reveals Buggy's legendary past to identify the Impel Down breakout perpetrators

events.title: Buggy's Connection to Shanks Revealed
events.description: During the same transmission, the Marine officer also reveals that Buggy has a deep connection to Red-Haired Shanks, one of the Four Emperors. The prisoners learn that Buggy and Shanks were crewmates and rivals on Roger's ship.
events.significance: This connection to one of the most powerful pirates in the world further elevates Buggy's reputation. It reinforces the perception that Buggy is an incredibly important and powerful figure, despite the reality being quite different.

quotes.text: Buggy is connected to Red-Haired Shanks, one of the Four Emperors!
quotes.speaker: Marine Officer
quotes.context: Revealing Buggy's relationship with Shanks to the shocked prisoners

events.title: Prisoners Rally Behind Buggy
events.description: After learning of Buggy's connections to Gol D. Roger and Shanks, the escaped Impel Down prisoners begin to view Buggy as a legendary figure. They rally behind him, pledging their allegiance and viewing him as their leader.
events.significance: This moment sets up Buggy's unintended rise to power. Despite his relatively weak combat abilities, Buggy's reputation and luck continue to elevate him to positions of great influence. This is a key step toward his eventual Warlord status.

quotes.text: Captain Buggy! We'll follow you anywhere!
quotes.speaker: Escaped Prisoners
quotes.context: The prisoners pledge their loyalty to Buggy after learning of his legendary connections

events.title: Buggy Convinces Prisoners to Head to Marine Headquarters
events.description: Despite initially being upset about heading to Marine Headquarters, Buggy manages to convince the escaped prisoners to continue toward the battlefield. He sells them on the dream of defeating Whitebeard and standing on top of the pirate world.
events.significance: This decision directly leads to Buggy's participation in the Marineford War, one of the most significant events in One Piece history. His presence at Marineford, combined with his perceived legendary status, will have major consequences for the balance of power.

quotes.text: Let's go to Marine Headquarters and stand on top of the pirate world!
quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Buggy rallying the prisoners to continue toward Marineford

events.title: Ace Arrives at Marine Headquarters
events.description: The ship carrying Portgas D. Ace successfully reaches Marine Headquarters at Marineford. With only three hours remaining until his execution, Ace is escorted to the gallows as the final preparations for the war begin.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of the Marineford War arc, one of the most significant story arcs in One Piece. Ace's arrival sets the stage for the massive battle between the Whitebeard Pirates, their allies, and the full might of the Marines.

events.title: Ace Recalls Promise with Luffy
events.description: As Ace is escorted to the gallows, he recalls his promise with Luffy about living freely without regrets. This flashback emphasizes the bond between the brothers and the tragedy of Ace's current situation.
events.significance: This emotional moment reinforces the stakes of the upcoming Marineford War and reminds viewers of the deep connection between Ace and Luffy, which drives Luffy's desperate mission to save his brother.

quotes.text: Luffy... I promised we would live freely, without regrets.
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace reflecting on his promise with Luffy as he heads to the gallows

events.title: Final Episode of Impel Down Arc
events.description: This episode concludes the Impel Down Arc, one of the most intense prison break stories in anime. The stage is now set for the Marineford War, with all major players heading toward the battlefield.
events.significance: The Impel Down Arc's conclusion transitions the story to the Marineford War, marking a shift from a prison break narrative to a large-scale war that will reshape the balance of power in the One Piece world.

themes.description: Buggy's elevation to legendary status despite his relatively weak actual power demonstrates the power of reputation and perception in the One Piece world. This theme is central to Buggy's character arc.
themes.symbolism: Buggy's connection to Roger and Shanks symbolizes how past associations can dramatically influence present circumstances, regardless of one's true abilities.

themes.description: The escaped prisoners celebrate their freedom from Impel Down, one of the most oppressive institutions in the World Government. Their journey represents rebellion against authority and the pursuit of freedom.
themes.symbolism: The hijacked Marine vessel traveling the government's own Tarai Current represents using the system's tools against itself.

themes.description: Ace's memories of his promise with Luffy emphasize the theme of brotherhood and the bonds that drive characters to risk everything for those they love.
themes.symbolism: The contrast between Ace heading to execution and Luffy heading to save him represents the ultimate test of their brotherly bond.

themes.description: Multiple storylines converge toward Marineford, suggesting that fate is drawing all these characters to a single pivotal moment that will change the world.
themes.symbolism: The Tarai Current carrying multiple groups toward the same destination represents the inexorable pull of destiny.

characterSpotlights.development: Buggy's past as a Roger Pirate is publicly revealed, dramatically elevating his status. Despite his fear and reluctance, he successfully convinces the escaped prisoners to follow him to Marineford.
keyActions: Has his Roger Pirates past revealed by Marines
Gains allegiance of escaped Impel Down prisoners
Convinces prisoners to head to Marine Headquarters
Accepts his new role as their leader
quotes: Let's go to Marine Headquarters and stand on top of the pirate world!

characterSpotlights.development: Shiryu makes the pivotal decision to abandon his position as Head Jailer and join the Blackbeard Pirates, demonstrating his ruthless pragmatism and ambition.
keyActions: Saves Blackbeard's crew with antidotes to Magellan's poison
Abandons his role as Head Jailer of Impel Down

characterSpotlights.development: Ace arrives at Marine Headquarters with only hours until his execution. His memories of Luffy emphasize the emotional weight of the upcoming events.
keyActions: Recalls his promise with Luffy about living freely
quotes: Luffy... I promised we would live freely, without regrets.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy celebrates the successful escape from Impel Down but remains focused on his mission to save Ace. He continues heading toward Marine Headquarters despite the overwhelming danger.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends several scenes with additional reactions from the escaped prisoners to Buggy's revealed past, adding more emphasis to his growing reputation.
Additional shots of Pandaman appearing five times throughout the episode among the escaped prisoners were added by the anime.

trivia.fact: This is the last episode of the Impel Down Arc, which consisted of 31 episodes (422-425, 430-452) spanning two years of broadcast from 2009-2010.
Pandaman appears five times throughout this episode in various scenes involving the escaped prisoners.
Episode 452 adapts only pages 2-17 of Chapter 549, making it a relatively faithful adaptation with minimal padding.
The Funimation simulcast aired one day before the Japanese broadcast, which was unusual for the time period.
Buggy's Roger Pirates connection revealed in this episode becomes a crucial factor in his later appointment as a Warlord of the Sea and eventually a Yonko.
Shiryu joining Blackbeard's crew in this episode marks the first recruit during Blackbeard's Impel Down raid, significantly strengthening his forces.
Starting from episode 279, ending themes were omitted from One Piece episodes. Episode 452 had no ending theme, and this practice continued until episode 1071.
